9950 Wellington Rd
Manassas, VA 20110

COVID-19 precautions will be in place so remember to wear your face mask

All people in the car will receive a COVID screening (not a test). If anyone is sick or has fever, the vaccine cannot be given that day

This event will be held rain or shine. No appointment needed - First come first served (limit 200 doses)

Parent/guardian must be present for their student to receive the vaccine, and must bring a copy of your child’s insurance card(s).

Please note: Insurance status does not determine your child’s eligibility to receive the vaccine.

Manassas Park City Schools announced it is participating in the Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (PEBT) program as part of a food assistance plan approved by the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA), Food and Nutrition Service (FNS) that is being implemented statewide by the Virginia Department of Social Services (VDSS) and the Virginia Department of Education (VDOE).

The Families First Coronavirus Response Act (P.L. 116-127) (FFCRA) authorized a temporary food assistance program for households with children affected by school closures during the nationwide public health emergency. The Food and Nutrition Service accepted state plans for the P-EBT program
and, pursuant to the authority granted under the FFCRA, FNS approved Virginia’s P-EBT operational plan
in late April.

More information can be found here: https://www.mpark.net/uploaded/ParentResources/Manassas_Park_pebt-media-release.pdf

Tomorrow MPCS will host its 5th Special Olympics Meet in the Middle event!

Join us from 10 am - noon at Cougar Stadium to see approximately 250 athletes from the area compete.

Also, did you know that October is Disability History and Awareness Month (DHAM) in Virginia? The 2009 Virginia General Assembly responded to the call from young people with disabilities to pass a resolution designating the month and to encourage public schools and universities to engage in activities that promote awareness. These same youth developed a vision statement for DHAM: Disability history education and awareness will promote positive attitudes in schools creating a culture of mutual respect, understanding, and equal opportunities for all.

We hope to see you tomorrow!

Thank you to everyone who voiced their concerns and offered possible solutions regarding the crossing guard situation at Cougar Court.

To make all families aware, MPCS is actively seeking substitute crossing guards to cover in cases of illness or emergency. Captain Reinhart of the Manassas Park Police Department also has graciously offered to assist when they have available resources.

MPCS is committed to ensuring that all students are safe when walking to and from school. Your support in this matter is very much appreciated, and as always, should you have further concerns or additional comments/questions, please feel free to contact the Office of the Superintendent at 703-335-8850.
